+    "interactions": {

+        "MAOIs (potential serotonin syndrome or neurotransmitter overload)",

+        "2-AI (serotonergic interaction)",
+        "A-PVP (cardiovascular stress)",
+        "Amphetamine (increased strain)",
+        "Mephedrone (combined stimulation)"
+      ]
+    },
+    "notes": "2C-T is a lesser-known research chemical with very limited human use history and minimal scientific data on its pharmacology, metabolism, and toxicity. It is structurally similar to 2C-T-2 and 2C-T-7 and may possess MAOI properties, making it potentially more dangerous when combined with other serotonergic substances. ## Arylcyclohexylamine (morpholine subgroup) | Dissociative NMDA-receptor antagonist with mild monoaminergic activity
